file_content.text: The Dread Masters... like the old Empire wasn't enough.
If you could step this way, please? The Supreme Chancellor requires your attention.
Master Jedi? We've been trying to contact you--the Supreme Chancellor needs your attention.
Major? Sorry to step outside the chain of command, but the Supreme Chancellor needs you.
Captain. You can be hard to reach. The Supreme Chancellor requires your attention.
What's going on?
She'll explain. One moment.
Good morning from Coruscant. As always, I appreciate your service on the front lines.
I appreciate your time, Master Jedi--I know the council keeps you busy.
It's good to see you, Major. General Garza says Havoc Squad deserves some downtime.
Captain, I appreciate your time. I know you have your business to see to.
But right now, I have another crisis brewing--and I've learned to trust your instincts.
That doesn't sound promising. Do the Imperials have a new weapon? Or is it something else?
Another new crisis?
You're very kind, Chancellor. How can I serve?
It's an honor to see you.
You trust my instincts? Chancellor... if you need me, you know my fee. You don't have to lie.
You must be pretty desperate.
You solve more problems than you cause. That's trust enough.
We're not friends, Chancellor, and the next election is a ways off. Why don't you tell me what you need?
Don't try to sweet-talk me.
I've supported you more than you know, but have it your way.
The Dread Masters--six rogue Sith Lords--have been terrorizing the galaxy since escaping Belsavis prison.
They've arranged catastrophes across the galaxy while amassing an army of followers.
We believe their end goal is to establish their own empire and to destroy the Republic and any Sith who resist.
Your defeat of Dread Master Styrak on Darvannis has been our only major victory to date.
We killed Dread Master Styrak on Darvannis--otherwise we've seen nothing but setbacks.
Twelve hours ago, we located the Masters' headquarters on Oricon. Six hours ago, we sent a task force to bombard it from orbit. That operation appears to have failed.
"Appears to have failed"? What was the last word from the task force?
Tell me what happened.
We've been looking for the Dread Masters awhile. How'd you finally pin them down?
How did you locate the base?
For all their power, they're a step behind in the stealth technology race. We're confident the location is real.
I met Dread Master Styrak, and I beat him. Why wasn't I part of that task force?
Why wasn't I involved?
If you'd told me this twelve hours ago, I might have been able to help.
You're a little late, then.
The ground portion of the campaign was intended to be minimal--it was primarily a space-based attack.
"Was."
We received this from one of the Jedi in command at Oricon.
This is Ogan-Dei--as soon as we entered orbit, the madness struck. The Dread Masters projected... images into our minds.
Personal images, shocking images. None of us were prepared, and our ships began to go down.
Still aim to smash their faces, sir! Three more ships non-responsive.
Steady, Sergeant.
Our Jedi intend to enter a trance. We'll shield our forces as they regroup on the surface....
That was five hours ago. We've heard nothing since.
I need you at Oricon today. I need the situation assessed, any survivors rescued--and if possible, the Dread Masters eliminated.
Fear is powerful in the hands of the Sith--but it can be overcome. I'm on my way.
I'll leave now. We'll prevail.
I'll do everything I can, but the Dread Masters are an ancient threat. Tell the Jedi Council to prepare for the worst.
Very well. Tell the council.
Havoc is ready to launch right away. We won't let you down.
I'll head out immediately.
I've got a fast ship and not much cargo to weigh me down. Let's just hope there's someone friendly left on Oricon.
Guess I'd better get going.
I'll do what I can, but there may be dozens of people stranded on the surface. Keeping them alive will be hard enough without mounting an assault.
The survivors are my priority.
The Dread Masters use the Force like no other Sith. They use Rakata and Gree technology. There's much we can learn up close.
Maybe I'll study their powers.
Maybe so, but we can't learn anything while they're expanding their territory. And if we fail today, dozens of worlds could fall.
Your task force didn't last long. What makes you think I'll do any better?
This sounds like suicide.
Call it hope or desperation. But someone has to go.
Keep in mind--with that fleet disabled, the Dread Masters will see an opportunity. They'll expand and fortify their territory.
If you must abandon the mission, I trust your judgment. But dozens of worlds will fall.
Coordinates sent to your ship. Good hunting.
If you'll excuse me, I have a call to make.
O6 = congratulating Republic hero // You = Republic hero // Dead Masters = no more!
Oricon + Dread Masters = a current priority
O6 = expecting important transmission // Return = another time
Message target = confirmed // Clearance rating = confirmed....
